comments.body: I don't think a mob that spawns IN the walls of a cave would be smart, unless they spawn with world gen and never respawn.  Otherwise they would be impossible to control later in the game and could ruin a player's builds as the continuously spawn and break down walls.
Like watcher in mountain and Rocky
This is actually a really good idea for a mob but in my opinion I would change the idea of the mob spawning in walls.
Another name: geo-monster
Lets call them stonegolems

I think it's an excellent idea! They should be quadruped golems (in the shape of a rhino), but not necessarily made of stone.

Why should they be added? Fix a big problem in minecraft combat: "Do you want to get out of any extreme risk situation? Build a block structure (any one) around you". This will protect you from 99% of the game's mobs, as well as being quick to build.

These mobs drop a ronoceros horn, joining 9 of these horns you can build a block that repels these mobs. By placing these blocks close to their homes, these mobs will not appear.
i really like the idea maybe make it kind of like a silver fish but the block doesnt need to be broken
I like it

I actually drew a made up mob I made. It is called the Ancient Golem. They sleep and blend into stone blocks. If you hit them, they will either attack you with their bare hands or throw stone cannonballs at you. They drop 5 stone blocks and 3 grass blocks. They spawn at a biome I made up called the Ancient Lands and when dig straight down in them it will actually take you to an Ancient City

Yes, it can be dangerous to stand behind a horse.  But we can imagine that the minecraft characters are doing the things to make sure the horse knows they're there and won't be startled.

I would support a horse being able to do kick damage to hostile mobs, tho.  As they can hurt the horse and are not going to be reassuring it.
Yes I agree Horses should become Neutral.

The goal of this feature would be to warn children about standing directly behind horses in real life.  If we assume that the players take the safe precautions, then players will be able to carelessly stand behind horses.  Taking the necessary precautions should be more deliberate.

 

Also, horses would not necessarily be made neutral; they just have a behavior that makes standing behind them dangerous.

I was kicked by a horse, and it is painful. Horse safety is needed. 

 

I think that the horse should be startled both when a player is on its back, and not.
Yeah. It could also kick it you attack it.
The problem here is that monsters would then become hostile to the horse and end up killing the horse. I think it would be a better idea for the horse to just run.
I love this idea especially if it alowed rodeos into Minecraft I have been wanting that for a  while. I hope this gets added in

tigers, lions and leopards, they will all sleep when the sun is up. and only a few are albino, their cubs are the size of a polar bear while their cubs are the size of a goat. The lion's mane can be cut and made into a riding animal, but the way to tame it is to feed it raw beef as well as others, while the crocodile can be ridden by taming it with fish and wearing it a saddle.
Deserts are and should be barren.
And I'm sure you have no reasoning behind that statement. Also Deserts aren't already barren in Vanilla Minecraft or in real life in that matter.

They have rabbits and cactus and the occasional dead bush in Minecraft.  They have cactus and rabbits in real life, too.  Deserts are not teeming with life.

Also, a lizard should be by no means tameable.  That would just be ridiculous.

Lizards are pets in real life pets and also live in desserts. And seeing as a game with Endermen and such  there wouldn't be a problem with adding/replacing the rabbits in desserts. Thank you for your input but it seems you only want to disagree with everything I say.
I do not see how Enderman have anything to do with rabbits and lizards.  Replacing the rabbits with a more deserty animal might be a good idea though.

Even some of the hottest deserts in the world such as the Sahara desert have more life than the deserts in Minecraft; foxes, antelope, vipers, cheetahs, gazelle, ostriches, and scorpions are some of the species native to the Saharan desert. So I have no idea why people are saying "it's a desert, it's supposed to be barren", besides, Minecraft deserts have more mobs than almost every other biome. The reason why sheep, cows, pigs, etc., aren't found in Minecraft deserts is because those species typically aren't found in deserts, at least not the Minecraft versions that look domesticated.
Deserts do contain a large variety in species of animals, but, like I said, they are not teeming with life.

Ive always wanted one of these for myself :) I have several reptiles and amphibians - would be great to carry over your real life passions into the game!  Id like to open a Minecraft reptile store!

 

Deserts are not barren and are in actuality full of life, scorpions snakes rodents and lizards are found all over the desert.  Lets not forget the screaming frog! :) The desert tortoises aka desert turtles, are two species of tortoise native to the Mojave and Sonoran Deserts of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico and the Sinaloan thornscrub of northwestern Mexico.
i am all for this why would you want deserts to be boring

desert only seem lifeless but at night a lot of creature come out from hiding, and even in day the desert is habited by lizards, snakes and birds. So I think we should add this new reptile to Minecraft deserts.

Currently in the game we already have the drowned and the way to differentiate their kappas is through their peculiarities.

The kappas are creatures of Japanese folklore, they have the size of children and the incredible ability to regenerate, they cannot get out of the water because they languish and take damage.

With the size of a baby zombie and the ability to regenerate, it would certainly be a great challenge to face this creature in the waters. So the solution I found in the legends to avoid it is through cucumbers, which can be either a new item or the existing sea pickle. In the legends, if you throw cucumbers at the Kappas, they felt morally obligated not to attack you, this would be a form of protection, even if temporary against them, in addition to being the biggest difference between them and the drowned.

Usually inhabiting rivers and lakes, they could be generated in swamps, to create greater diversity in such a biome, with more challenges and dangers, in addition to increasing all the mythology within the game.

You know what would be funny. In Japanese mythology, the Kappa have sort of a dip on their heads called the dish (sara) that they fill with water when they leave the water. If that dish gets empty whilst out of the water, they die.

In Minecraft, they could also occasionally leave the water and walk clumsily to villages (to trade). Some might have their dish half-empty and by filling it with a water bucket, they could befriend you or just give you a little present.

With the new announcement made for the future drop featuring happy ghasts, I think the idea of being able to tame grumpy ghasts as well is a really cool idea. Given that dried ghasts are turned into ghastlings by soaking them with a bucket of water, I would like to venture an addition to your idea. Instead of being able to tame a grumpy ghast just by taking it to the overworld, the player should also need to hydrate it. Right clicking on the ghast with a water bucket (the water would evaporate immediately upon being used on the ghast) would turn it into a mix of the grumpy and happy ghasts. The ghast would have a tired, but relieved expression, still in pain but thankful for the brief reprieve (if you want to make it really sad, using a bucket on it could have a small chance of dropping a ghast tear). As you specified in the original post, this new version of the ghast would now only target other players. It can be tempted to the player, not by snowballs but by a bucket of water. You can continue to use buckets of water on the ghast, which it will appreciate. Unlike the happy ghast, this new variation would still be immune to fire and lava damage. 

All versions of the ghast should definitely be updated to allow the player to stand on them. Whether or not it can be ridden is up for debate. Personally, yes please. However, I think an argument can be made that it would be too OP. If it is rideable it would need a different saddle texture to warn other players to not get too close
